snippet: Not since 1415, when Gregory XII stood down, has a pope surrendered the keys of St Peter. But Gregory's resignation did not, of course, mark the end of the political centrality of the papacy in European affairs.
abstract: Not since 1415, when Gregory XII stood down, has a pope surrendered the keys of St Peter. But Gregory's resignation did not, of course, mark the end of the political centrality of the papacy in European affairs.

headline.main: 6 Centuries Ago, a Precedent for This Pope
